headline: More Bonds Are Teetering on the Brink of Junk: Credit Weekly
summary: The first full week of the year has been one of the busiest for US corporate debt sales on record, and risk premiums stayed low even amid heavy issuance.  Around $63 billion of US corporate bonds in the high-grade universe have a high-yield rating from one bond grader, a BBB- rating from others, and at least one negative outlook, according to the bank’s review based on ratings for debt in its high-grade US index.  “As companies continue to refinance debt, the pressure on their balance sheets from rising interest expense is growing,” said Nathaniel Rosenbaum, a US high-grade credit strategist at JPMorgan.

summary: Ares Management (ARES) is back in focus after partnering with Goal Investment Management to acquire and manage consumer loan portfolios, while upcoming fourth quarter 2025 earnings expectations and recent analyst sentiment keep investor attention firmly on the stock.
